sage.scene.state

Class TextureState

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.state.RenderState
      • sage.scene.state.TextureState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JOGLTextureState

    public abstract class TextureState
extends RenderState
    TextureState maintains the texture state for a given SceneNode. A given TextureState object can maintain a number of states at one time, up to the number of texture units available on the GPU. Note that it is not within the scope of this class to generate Texture objects; these must be generated externally by client classes (e.g. using TextureManager loadTexture() methods) and stored into the TextureState by the client using methods such as setTexture(Texture).
    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextureState

        public TextureState()
        Creates a new TextureState object with a default texture. If this constructor fails to set up a default texture (for example because it cannot find the default texture image), it will log that fact, creating the TextureState instance without a default texture; in this case it is the client's responsibility to install a Texture in the TextureState using setTexture(Texture).

    • Method Detail

      • getRenderStateType

        public RenderState.RenderStateType getRenderStateType()
        Returns the RenderState.RenderStateType RenderState.RenderStateType.Texture.
        Specified by:
        getRenderStateType in class RenderState
        Returns:
        A RenderStateType value identifying this render state object.

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(Texture texture)
        Sets the Texture object to be used by this TextureState. The Texture is assigned by default to the first texture unit.
        Parameters:
        texture - - the texture to set.

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(Texture texture,
                       int textureUnit)
        Assigns the specified Texture object to the specified Texture Unit in this TextureState. If the specified texture unit is not valid (i.e. is less than zero or greater than the number of texture units supported by the graphics card) an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        texture - the texture to be used by the state.
        textureUnit - the texture unit this texture will fill.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the texture unit is not supported on the graphics card.

      • getTexture

        public Texture getTexture()
        getTexture() gets the Texture that is assigned to the first texture unit.
        Returns:
        the texture in the first texture unit, or null if no texture is assigned to unit 0.

      • load

        public void load()
        Loads the textures in this TextureState into the underlying rendering system, generating mipmaps if appropriate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there are no textures assigned to this TextureState

      • load

        public abstract void load(int unit)
        Loads the texture for the given unit into the underlying rendering system, generating mip maps if appropriate.

      • getTexture

        public Texture getTexture(int textureUnit)
        getTexture() retrieves the texture being used by this TextureState in the specified texture unit.
        Parameters:
        textureUnit - the texture unit to retrieve the texture from.
        Returns:
        the texture assigned to the specified texture unit in the TextureState, or null if the texture unit is invalid or no texture is assigned to the unit.

      • apply

        public abstract void apply()
        This method must be implemented by concrete TextureState classes to apply the render state to the underlying graphics system. It is intended to be invoked by IRenderer implementations, not by game application code.
        Specified by:
        apply in class RenderState
